topics.body:
I was reading up on philosophy on the idea of what defines good vs what defines evil and how "evil" is actually a learned trait, basically how no one is born a racist or a asshole, and I realized something kind of funny; for all the people and so forth that constantly bang people over the head with "You're evil" I could never actually be evil.

What I mean by this is all the people that go, "humans are evil" are full of shit cause when you get right down to it the basis of this logic relies on basically guilt tripping people about something they once did to make them feel as though all humans are evil and go around claiming that somehow it's hard coded in your dna to be evil.  The problem with that immediately is people like me; you could give me all the power in the world and I could control the world politically, economically, societally and to such a point that I could control everything, but you know how I would abuse that?  Blackjack and hookers for everyone!

The problem with a lot of philosophies and people that say humans are fundamentally evil is that you have to learn how to be "evil"; no one started out as a toddler wanting to hurt others in the belief that hurting others was what was best for the person you're hurting.

Tl:dr; A lot of people are full of shit cause they ignore learned behaviour.  Also the so called "secret" of what people idolize as "good" when you think about it is just the realization that no hurting others for their "good" doesn't automatically mean you're doing the right thing.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538949f5636872740e1e0400#post_538949f5636872740e1e0400

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53894b54636872717b0d0600#post_53894b54636872717b0d0600
When you get right down to it being "good" is essentially realizing how full of shit the idea of "If I hurt people and say it's good for them then it's good" is.

When you get right down to it the vast majority of atrocities done in history have been because of this idea that intentionally hurting others is "good".  If you believe that hurting others is good then yyeeaaaahhhhh chances are you're not a good person.  What I mean by this is there's a *BIG* difference between accidentally hitting a pedestrian and intentionally hitting a pedestrian.

The problem a lot of people have is that they immediately go, "Hurting others is good therefore it's good to do" and immediately brush it off as right; no real thought into it or any level of "is this the right thing?" just instant just right the fuck to "I did the right thing".
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538949f5636872740e1e0400#post_538949f5636872740e1e0400
racism is inborn, self interest is inborn.

The reason guilt tripping humanity is often dumb is because those who do it hold people to standards that don't exist without humans.

And, usually, you can only guilt trip good and conscientious people. People who are actually 'bad' are often unrepentant.

One need not get into philosophy to criticize sanctimonious do gooders.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53894fe16368721250960000#post_53894fe16368721250960000
Animals are actually very in-group.
Racism is preferring your group over others.

Humans are naturally racist, animals are naturally hostile to other groups.

And actually, there is a brain chemical which increases racist sentiments, it is also connected to trust and generosity. In-group preference behavior.

I don't even know how you can say self interest is not inborn.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538950b4636872116be40000#post_538950b4636872116be40000
Personally the way I view it is that when you get right down to it all that there really is actions being undertaken having consequences to them.

When it comes to morals I think people should find a single idea to form as the basis for their morals and make it the foundation of their entire morals; sure they may not be 100% logical infallible, but they are more sturdy than having thousands of ideas constantly competing to see which one to be the founding block.

The foundation for my morals is the idea of, "do no harm"; is it 100% logical and infallible?  Hell no.  Is it possible to do no harm in every situation?  No, but it still forms a good foundation for everything to build off of.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5389515a63687210e0d30000#post_5389515a63687210e0d30000
There's a *BIG* difference between herd mentality and someone burning a cross in someone's yard.

I'm not saying self interest isn't inborn, but rather even animals show some level of thinking not just for themselves.  What I mean by this is to use a analogy think of a herd of animals; would acting as a single unit be a good evolutionary trait?  Would being selfish be good for the whole of the herd?  Even a lot of predatory animals show basic thinking about the health of the species rather than themselves.  To use a analogy think of how when cats know they're going to die they run off.  It's a basic evolutionary trait of they don't know why they're sick and dying, but they still run off in case it's a virus or such from being transmitted to others.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5389539b63687210461b0100#post_5389539b63687210461b0100
Chimps tend to be quite hostile to chimps from another group enough to kill each other, even the peace-loving bonobos will sometimes kill members of other groups just because they are from a different part of the jungle...just like humans.
